channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large potholes on A40 going towards town, 15th April
item.description:
There are several large potholes and gullies turning left onto the A40 from Princess Elizabeth Way going towards town. This is adjacent to the bus lane and has been getting worse over the past few weeks. This is enough to damage a vehicle. Evasive driving is getting harder as the potholes are getting bigger!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 42 MONKS, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several potholes now merging into one large one., 15th April
item.description:
There are several potholes now merging into one long strip just after the bend going from Granley Road into Swanswell drive on the left hand side of the road, just before getting to Finstock Close.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 Swanswell Drive, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Plastic cooking oil containers, 15th April
item.description:
Quite a pile of plastic cooking oil containers have been dumped in a lay bye half way along the lane (on the left, if approaching from the A436)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Grove View KILKENNY||||0|0|, Andoversford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing rubbish bins & litter all down road, 15th April
item.description:
Both bins in the layby on the opposite side of the A435 to the Oxenton junction, are full & overflowing & litter has blown on verges both before & after the layby & it looks a right mess as well as being a danger to wildlife. A435 speed limit is too fast for Tewkesbury Borough Council litterpicker volunteers to pick in this area. Looks awful & clearly not been emptied for a while. Please empty & clear verges of litter ASAP. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A435, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Regular blocking of dropped kerb by cars parking on double yellow lines, 13th April
item.description:
Cars regularly (monitored over 6 months) park on double yellow lines blocking the dropped kerb. This means that prams, wheelchair users and kids have to go around, and attempt to cross in less safe zones.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 212 Hewlett Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
